content.description:
From the belay anchors move up and left and climb the face between Yellow Spotted Salamander and Twelve Years After. A fun short route.



To gain access to this route you will need to get on the large ledge that breaks up the main face as it changes from slab to vertical face (Love Ledge). You can either climb Hylonda, rap from Twelve years After or scramble up a fixed line on the right (low 5th class). 


Bolts and bolted anchor rap rings.

Head up and get established under the roof. Pull the roof and make your way up the face using seams. A fun crux comes near the top. Move to the final ledge and clip the anchor. 



On the right side of the main wall located the large notch/roof. This climbs on the right side of the roof and up the face through seams.

7 bolts and bolted anchor

climbs.name: Bucha Boys
climbs.fa: Duncan Gillies and Caleb Mazurkiewicz and Dalton Landry

content.description:
The crux of the route is at the start. Bolt 2 and 3. After bolt 3 you can use the tree stump to help get yourself onto the ledge.

This is a great climb for those starting to lead.



On the far left side of the main wall there is a dirty ramp/ gully. At the top you will see the first bolt and a nice ledge to start your climb. This is the furthest bolted line on the left side of the main wall. 

There is a comfortable belay at the bottom of the ramp/ gully.

10 bolts. Quickdraws

Shares first two bolts and anchor with Bucha Boys. After second bolt climb up to anchor direct through crimps, rails, and slabby feet keeping bolt line on your right. 



Shares first two bolts and anchor with Bucha Boys

7 Bolts, Quick Draws

Climb through broken up section, the rock quality improves dramatically after 3rd bolt. Move through pockets then some easier climbing to flakes.  Then follow the bolts through cruxy slab moves to the anchor.



10 bolts. Quick draws and rap rings

"So nice they named it twice." Start up and move slightly right of belay anchor. Clip the first bolt and step up and left onto a small ledge. Reach out and clip the second bolt then traverse slightly right from the ledge to the face, immediately into a boulder problem. Fun movement brings you through the bolts to the top where massive victory jugs await. Top-out on the "Beer Ledge" and enjoy one of the best views in the province.



To gain access to this route you will need to get on the large ledge that breaks up the main face as it changes from slab to vertical face (Love Ledge). You can either climb Hylonda, rap from Twelve years After or scramble up a fixed line on the right (low 5th class). 

Bring quick draws. Bolted belay and rap station.

Climb to the ledge 10ft off the ground. Move on to the face clipping two closely spaced bolts and fire through the crux. Fun climbing through a flake system brings you to the top. 



This is the first route to the right of the ledge (Love ledge) that splits the main face. 

10 bolts and rap anchor

climbs.name: Eagle Dance
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Caleb Mazurkiewicz, Duncan Gillies November, 2020

content.description:
Very enjoyable movement, good rock and nice flow. This climb shares a bolted anchor with Moving Meditation but you could also climb up onto a big ledge and use a tree with a chain anchor if MM is in use. 



Right between Moving Meditiation and Shut Your Shunt. Easy climbing up to first bolt so you could skip the stick clip.

9 bolts, bolted anchor

climbs.name: GT Express
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Eric Samis and Kurt MacDonald

content.description:
If it weren't for the fact that this route is broken up by a couple of ledges it would be at least 3 stars. It is still an enjoyable route, especially the final 30 feet.



Far left hand side of the Main Wall. Just left of Bucha Boys


10 bolts, bolted anchor

climbs.name: Harddwych
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Michel Martin, November, 2020

content.description:
Fantastic movement and great stone. The crux is very well protected. Figuring out the feet can be challenging.



This route is located directly above Hylonda. It can easily be combined with this route or you can climb them in two pitches. From the Hylonda bolted anchor step left then up and slightly right to clip the first bolt. From here follow the bolts straight up the slabby face.

8 bolts, bolted anchor with rings.

climbs.name: Horseshoes and Rasslin
climbs.fa: Caleb Mazurkiewicz and Greg Hughes, May, 2020

content.description:
A real slab climbing test piece. Trust those feet!


Located on the left side of the wall. Currently the second bolted line from the far left.


Bolts all the way.

Ugly but good. Like a lot of the lower part of the cliff it doesn't look the best but it climbs surprisingly well.  When you reach the anchor you have the option to continue straight up on Hardwychh, traverse right (2 more bolts) to a ledge and bolted belay. From this ledge you can access 5 more routes.


Bottom right hand side of the main wall. It is the first bolted line encountered on the right side from the ground.
Four protection bolts, bolted anchor. Rap the route.

climbs.name: Kombucha Queen
climbs.fa: Eric Samis, Kurt MacDonald, Caleb Mazurkiewic

content.description:
Located in between Bucha Men & Horseshoes and Rasslin. Clip the low first bolt at base of climb, climb up some easy climbing to second & third bolt. After clipping third bolt climb slighlty right and up towards next bolts through some crimps, & slab moves to some hand rails.  Route ends at base of the head wall.



Located in between Bucha Men & Horseshoes and Rasslin

7 Bolts, Bolted anchor at top

Start up the short corner. Move towards a horizontal crack in the corner. Then utilize flakes on the face to the right and progress to the anchor. Short but fun. This route was initially climbed as a PG/R trad line but was retro bolted on the April 28th 2021. 



On the far right end of the main wall slightly up hill from Big Agnes in the Sky. Locate a short corner with a seam. anchor can be seen from the ground. 


Fully bolted with rap anchor. 

*If you would like to climb it trad bring small gear for up top otherwise it becomes R.*

climbs.name: Moving Meditation
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Caleb Mazurkiewicz, June, 2020

content.description:
Pleasant, well protected route on good stone. 


This is the second bolted line right of the center slab. About 20 feet right of Turkeys and Turtles.

9 bolts, bolted anchor.

Nice steep start with three bolts and then gain a ledge at the beginning of higher quality granite.

Trend right following a crack system to a bolt which protects a tricky move on a blank slab. Follow the

corner crack system with good gear to a tree ledge and belay. Rap from the route. This is a nice long pitch and has a great deal of variety to make for a unique climbing experience. 



This is the second route from the left of the center. Almost directly above the Main Wall sign.


4 bolts, a light rack of nuts and cams (.3 to .75 camalots), tree anchor, rap to the route with a 70 meter rope

Climb the obvious corner three meters to the left of Little Bear. Easy climbing up to the roof leads to a fun crux followed by more easy climbing. 



Located to the left of the roof between Little Bear and Big Agnes

Single rack only and gear that is G. Bolted anchor with rap rings

Sandwiched between horseshoes and rasslin and chalky toes. Climb up short face near a small right facing corner. Pull some fun moves to get on the slab then continue through a few more thoughtful moves to the anchor. You can easily continue on and climb the upper half of either of its neighbouring routes.


6 bolts and rap anchor

climbs.name: Scar
climbs.fa: Caleb Mazurkiewicz, Dalton MacNeil and Kyle Landry

content.description:
Start off with some face climbing with blocky holds working your way up and to the left of a precarious looking detached pillar. Once past this pillar the rock quality improves drastically and the climbing becomes exponentially more enjoyable. Climb through a pleasant crack system/dihedral to the bolted anchor.

It should be implied when rock climbing but to reiterate, It’s highly recommended for you and your belayer to wear a helmet. 



Located to the right of Turkeys and Turtles. Follow face to the right of the small roof then climb the right most dihedral 

11bolts and rap anchors

Stick clip the first bolt and move up through technical moves towards the roof. Use crimps to move into the roof, after pulling the roof you're rewarded with better holds. Make your way up the arette using slopers, crimps and sidepulls. Pull one more committing sequence that eventually leads to jugs to the top..



locate the large notch/roof at the right end of the main wall. This route climbs up the middle of the notch and moves out to the arrette. 

7 bolts and bolted anchor

Start below the detached block three meters right of Big Agnes in the sky. Climb to the top of the block and make a big move to a horizontal crack.  From the crack move right and finish with a nice face climb to the top.



To the right of Big Agnes in the Sky

6 bolts and rap ring anchor

Start up the corner until holds get scarce. Navigate the small technical roof to gain better rock. Eventually get rewarded with jugs and a full rest before attacking the upper section. Move up and slightly left from ledge, then back right aiming for a right slanting seam that will take you to the top. 



Found just left of Moving Meditation on the main face. Finishes at large tree. 

12 bolts. chains on tree.

Full length route. Start by climbing technical face, crux starting just below the roof. Once through the crux difficulty eases with good rests. Climbing picks back up near the top in the dihedral leading to a second easier crux. A few more fun moves bring you to the top. Nice variety of movement.



locate a small roof to the right of large ledge that splits the main wall. Follow bolts to the top


Chain anchor, 13 bolts

climbs.name: Twelve Years After
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Caleb Mazurkiewicz, June, 2020

content.description:
Step up off the belay ledge and move into the shallow corner and climb the flake to a ledge clipping a couple of bolts along the way. Move up through the shallow corner, climbing a large flake then make a mantle move up the a big ledge. Two more bolts protect the short slab before the two bolt anchor.


The start of this route is on a big flat ledge about 50 feet off the base of the cliff. If you climb The New Standard you will rap down beside the route the ledge where it starts. Other options are to climb Hylonda and then traverse right from the bolted anchor to the big ledge or simply follow the fixed line below and right that reaches the ground.

6 bolts, bolted rap station, rap the route.

From belay anchor move up onto a ledge and walk left until the ledge tapers out. Climb up using small holds heading for a left facing bulge and a small ledge. From the ledge move up and right over the bulge to gain a slab. Crimp and smear your way up through a few more moves and then finish on easier terrain. 

To gain access to this route you will need to get on the large ledge that breaks up the main face as it changes from slab to vertical face (Love Ledge). You can either climb Hylonda, rap from Twelve years After or scramble up a fixed line on the right (low 5th class).  Clip the Bolts, Bolted rap and Belay.

This is the tallest part of the cliff in about the center of the long band of rock. The longest route here is about 35 meters but it is possible to rappel to the ground with a 60 meter rope in one rappel if you move right towards Turkeys and Turtles. Tie knots as it could end up being a rope stretcher!
